titleInfo.title: Oral history interview with Mildred Owsley Buchanan, 1980 November, excerpt 04

physicalDescription.note: Excerpted from: CentIIIBuchanan audio cassette recording converted to mp3 format in 2006.

location.physicalLocation: Special Collections Division of the Nashville Public Library, 615 Church Street, Nashville, Tennessee, 37219

mods.abstract: An excerpt from an oral history interview with Nashville educator Mildred Owsley Buchanan., conducted on two dates in November 1980 by Paul Clements as part of the Century III Nashville: Nashville Heritage Project. Buchanan, a home economics teacher in Nashville city schools from the late 1920s through ca. 1963, discusses her family's meals when she was growing up. She explains that they had two hot meals a day--breakfast and lunch--and that supper consisted of leftovers or bread and milk. The complete interview is available in the repository.

titleInfo.title: Century III Nashville: Nashville Heritage Project
